decision_conditions: The proposed extensions, to this previously extended property, gives rise to a form of development that, by reason of the extent of the alterations to the roof, including the raising of the roof, the formation of crown roof, and insensitive alterations to the rear elevation, would result in excessive cumulative bulk, scale and mass of the  extensions allowing a degree of visibility in the wider rear garden environment would significantly harm the character of the host building and be an intrusive and unneighbourly development thereby having an adverse effect on the visual amenities and character of the area, contrary to Policies DC61 and DC69 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008 and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD and the Emerson Park Policy Area SPD.

The large opening areas on the rear elevation, in particular from the 2nd floor lounge, would, by reason of its position and proximity to neighbouring properties would cause overlooking and loss of privacy which would have a serious and adverse effect on the living conditions of adjacent occupiers, contrary to Policies DC61 and DC69 of the London Borough of Havering LDF Core Strategy and Development Control Policies DPD 2008 and the London Borough of Havering Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD and the Emerson Park Policy Area SPD.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent Mr Grant Cameron via email on the 05/10/20.
description: First floor rear extension, conversion of roof space to habitable use involving conversion of roof from hip to gable end and to include 3 front and 5 rear dormers, internal alterations and replacement of doors and windows on rear elevation
